title: HW1 Q5
content: Problem context: This is a past midterm question that also adds another perspective on how data augmentation can provide a regularizing effect. In the previous homework, you saw augmenting with fake data that was very different from the given data. Here, the augmentation is modifications of the existing data for use during training. Data augmentation is a really important part of deep learning practice, and it is good to understand why it works in a very simple setting.
document:
Problem context: This is a past midterm question that also adds another perspective on how data augmentation can provide a regularizing effect.  In the previous homework, you saw augmenting with fake data that was very different from the given data. Here, the augmentation is modifications of the existing data for use during training. 

Data augmentation is a really important part of deep learning practice, and it is good to understand why it works in a very simple setting.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>This is an example of a question that builds on concepts that you know but forces you to learn something that hasn't been covered or even alluded to in lecture. We will do this with some regularity on the HW because one of our key learning objectives is to make sure you are able to learn things later that we haven't taught you. A curated problem like this is a way to get you ready to venture out into the unknown. </paragraph></document>
